CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 16, 1961, pg. A14, reads: "Councilman's Wife Fetes Charming Pair - Lovely Party - Mrs. James A. Jordon, wife of City Councilman Jordon, entertained last Saturday afternoon in honor of her mother, Mrs. O.S. Bond, and Mrs. Sari Patton of New York City. Here a partial group of the guests surrounds the two charming visitors, for a picture in garden of the Jordon home on Andover Terrace. Left to right, seated : Mmes. Albert Goldsmith, Loius [sic] J. Reizenstein, the two honorees, Mrs. Bond and Mrs. Patton, with Charlene, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. Charles Foggie, between them; Mrs. Harold Jones, a new bride, and Mrs. William Frederick.  Standing: Mmes. J.P. Howell, Everette Utterback, Miss Charlotte Primas, Mmes. A. Pulliam, B. Dykes, William Goode, William Morgan, Roland Sawyer, the hostess, M. Jordon; H. Morrison, E.H. Robinson, Robert Lavelle, H. Garland, LuGene Bray, Leslie Shelton, E. Burley and Charles Foggie. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left: Mrs. Albert Goldsmith, Florence J. Reizenstein, Mrs. O. S. Bond, Charlene Foggie, Mrs. Sari Patton, Mrs. Harold Jones, Mrs. William Frederick; standing: Mrs. J. P. Howell, Bernice Utterback, Charlotte Primas, Alma Pulliam, Mrs. B. Dykes, Mrs. William Goode, Mrs. William Morgan, Aileen Eckstein Sawyer, Marion Bond Jordon, Mrs. H. Morrison, Marie Robinson, Mrs. Robert Lavelle, Hazel Garland, Mrs. LuGene Bray, Mrs. Leslie Shelton, Mrs. E. Burley, and Madeline Sharpe Foggie, gathered in garden of Jordon home, Andover Terrace
